body.name: Tide Antibacterial Fabric Spray, 22 Fl Oz (Pack of 1)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 8 hrs 16 mins
features: Kills 99.9% of bacteria* when used as directed
Use on clothes, bedding, car seats, couches, dog beds, towels, and more
body.description: Tide Antibacterial Fabric Spray is specially designed to kill 99.9% of bacteria* left behind on fabrics and fight germs on hard surfaces (when used as directed). Every day, we come in contact with a variety of unclean surfaces, and millions of bacteria from these surfaces can linger on our clothes, linens, and upholstery. Lucky for you, Tide’s sanitizing spray keeps your home germ-free and fresh by eliminating those pesky bacteria from hard-to-wash-items. Tide Antibacterial Fabric Spray is also a worthy solution for anyone looking to eliminate odors and refresh clothes in between washes. Now, disinfecting your most-used items is easier than ever. So, when the thought of bacteria crawling on your backpack makes you shudder, just spray it, don't say it. nn*Effective against Staphylococcus aureus, Salmonella enterica, Escherichia coli, and Proteus mirabilis on hard, non-porous surfaces; Enterobacter aerogenes, Staphylococcus aureus on soft surfaces/fabrics. Use as directed.

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #1,505 in Health & Household (See Top 100 in Health & Household) #9 in Fabric Deodorizer

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for hockey gear
reviews.reviewText: This stuff works great! I use it to spray down my hockey gear after a game and then let it dry in front of a fan. My gross, sweaty equipment gets coated with this spray so when it dries it smells great and it prevents bacteria from forming (which is the cause of most of the bad “hockey gear smell”). It’s easy to spray on and the bottle has lasted quite a while. I highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Febreeze and Lysol combined!
reviews.reviewText: It disinfects and makes everything smell great. I use it on the couches where my husband likes to put his feet up and where the cats like to lay. It doesn't hurt your nose like Lysol and it's not so obvious and overpowering like febreeze. It just smells like you put your couch in the washer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Seems to work nice
reviews.reviewText: I got the slate this afternoon I walked around, sprayed the couch, sprayed the chairs, gonna take it out to my car and spray the car seats. What I like most is it doesn’t have the flowery smell that some of the other fabric sprays have. I will definitely buy this again

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Helps with doggie odors
reviews.reviewText: I use this to spray down my living roomthrow pillows or blankets. It gets rid of the doggie odor much better than regular fabric spray because this kills the bacteria causing the stink; it doesn’t just mask it. It has a nice clean, fresh scent that’s not overwhelming and that seems to fade after a day or two. I highly recommend if you have pets, kids, or stinky spouses.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Reduces the smell of body odor on clothing after it was worn
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to remove some underarm odor on a bridesmaid dress before I attempted to sell it. The product can be sprayed on the clothing and then washed however this particular dress was not dry clean or machine washable. It did reduce the smell but it took numerous attempts along with hanging it in front of an open window. There seemed to be some very faint remnants underarm odor which is a shame because the dress was very pretty and well made. Also, you have to be careful to not spray too heavily on the fabric or it made leave an outline of a stain. I would definitely use this product again if the clothing was machine washable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely recommend this product for freshening up the house! I spray it on our beds every day (especially my daughter’s since the dog sleeps with her & I worry about germs she may carry in from outside). I also spray curtains, rugs, furniture, the dog bed, throw blankets, any clothing that is getting reworn, pillows… it gives me a sense of security knowing that there are less germs making their way into our home and it smells so good! I wait until everyone is walking out the door to give it a chance to dry while no one will be home.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love the scent it's very light and not so obvious. It worked on winter coats brought out from storage. The value is great 2 bottles for good price. Seems to have lasted a few days so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars How did I not buy this before?
reviews.reviewText: This fabric freshener spray is excellent, easy to use and the fragrance is awesome! It's not overpowering and dries so quickly! I have already found so many items it will be used for! Plus this purchase was a 2 bottle deal! How do you say no to that? Definitely recommend if you want something that dries quickly and just smells great and handles hidden germs too! I will be purchasing more when these bottles run out!
